name: Renaissance St. Petersburg Baltic Hotel

reviews.text: I have to say I did not have very high expectations of the Renaissance as the reviews on the Trip Advisor website were not that great....But I was pleasantly surprised....
reviews.title: Loved the Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect.... It was half a block from St. Isaac's Cathedral, 10-15 minute walk to the Hermitage and the Church of Spilled Blood... We even walked to SS Peter and Paul Fortress which was a hike... It took us about 30-40 minutes but it is doable.... Let me preface this by saying I am not a walker and I go everywhere in my heels(platforms) but I did not have problems with that walk....
reviews.title: Just Perfect

likes.disliked: — Bathroom could be a bit bigger

reviews.text: The best kept secret of the hotel( which I don't understand why nobody has mentioned it) is that the hotel has a special relationship with the Hermitage Musem.... So all of its hotel guests can enter tnrough a separate entrance...(which is actually the group entrance)... We felt like VIPS.... The Lady at the door would aannounce to the Lady at the end of the Hall who was selling the Tickets that we were from the Renaissance and we did not have to fall in line at all....All we needed to show was our hotel keys....IT was GREAT!
reviews.title: Recommended for location, service

reviews.text: The service in the hotel was outstanding. We arrived 3 hours before check in time but we only had to wait 20 minutes and while we were awaiting they offered us juice, champange or water... And they had the best chocolates whcih they offered to us all day.... Our suite (Rm 804) which overlooked the St. Isaac's Cathedral was wonderful. The suite was not too large but it had 2 rooms (bedroom and Sitting room) and a nicely appointed bathroom.....It felt new and very clean... The beddings were the best and the pillows very luxurious.... We loved coming back to it at the end of the day.....
reviews.title: Renaissance vs Petro Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommended the Renaissance Hotel....
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location

reviews.text: We stayed here over Christmas, for 4 nights. This is a fairly new hotel, and the staff / service could not have been better. Everything from the champagne served upon check-in, our complimentary room upgrade to the Christmas gift waiting in our room from the Hotel Manager, made our stay extremely enjoyable. The location is ideal, right near St. Isaacs Cathedral, and within walking distance of all the major sights (Hermitage, Palace Square, Nevski Prospect). We also used the Concierge to pre-purchase train tickets from London, the girls were only too helpful. Would definiltey recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
Good Hotel for Russia
reviews.text: Last week I returned from a 10 day trip to Eastern Europe. St Petes and Warsaw Poland. Russia, I found to be very interesting and, supposedely, greatly improved recently. However the choice of affordable hotels is minimal. The Renaissance Marriott hotel was oly open for 2 weeks when we arrived in May. It was very neat and clean though not all the facilities were open yet, like the gym.
Stayed here on business in January 2007.
reviews.title: OK hotel, great location

likes.liked: — huge king size comfy bed with lovely bedding and pillows
likes.disliked: — can't open a window, very expensive broadband connections

reviews.text: Agree with some of the other reviewers - make sure you get an room that faces outside. I had a king size room with an outside view but several of my co-workers had the inward facing rooms and weren't overly impressed. You can't open the windows for fresh air which I hate, but the aircon was efficient and quiet. Very nice bathroom with bath and shower although the water temperature was a little hard to get right - either too hot or too cold. Very comfy bed and masses of pillows which was lovely.
reviews.title: Perfect location, ok service, but warnings

reviews.text: Rubbish selection of english speaking television channels compared to other international hotels of a similar rating.
reviews.title: They try hard - but fail!

reviews.text: Very friendly, english speaking staff. Bar staff were welcoming and efficient. Lovely coffee and italian style hot chocolate. Lovely breakfast spread and the food in the restaurant is above average if you're eating in. Very convenient, close to many of the major sites - easy walk to the Hermitage. Room service a bit hit and miss, they say you get your food for free if they don't deliver in 45 minutes, but in practice you have to argue your point to get it, they won't volunteer it!!!
reviews.title: Convenient location, mediocre hotel

reviews.text: Generally OK and probably a good bet for St Petersburg either business or vacation.
reviews.title: more Marriott less Russia

description: The Renaissance St. Petersburg Baltic Hotel is an ideal place to enjoy the city's charm with a fabulous location next to St. Isaac's Cathedral and steps away from Mariinsky Theatre and the Hermitage Museum. From the moment you arrive, the hotel captivates you with an elegant interior, fresh-cut flowers and original artwork. Luxurious, well-appointed accommodations offer comfortable furnishings and large work area with broadband. For a conference or banquet, choose from a ballroom for 200 guests or smaller meeting room. To relax and unwind, visit the fitness centre and sauna, which is a tradition in Russia perfect for the body and soul. Canvas Restaurant offers the finest International and Russian specialties from our award-winning chef and great wines to complement your fare. During famous White Nights, have a cocktail on the 6th Floor Terrace while enjoying views of the cathedral.
